title: COD Simulation Dashboard
shortDescription: Comprehensive business metrics and ROI calculator for COD e-commerce.
description: A comprehensive calculator and dashboard designed for Cash on Delivery (COD) e-commerce businesses. This application helps track business metrics, operational costs, and calculate ROI in real-time. Features include dual UI modes (Guest & Productivity), theme support, and detailed metrics tracking for operations, call center, and shipping.
personalExperience: Built this tool to help e-commerce business owners visualize their expenses and profits. It focuses on providing a clear, real-time financial overview.

title: Mosquito Killer DZ
shortDescription: Landing page for selling mosquito killer devices.
description: A high-conversion landing page designed for the Algerian market to sell mosquito killer devices. Features a streamlined order form, product showcase, and integration with local delivery services.
personalExperience: Designed to maximize conversion rates for a local e-commerce product. Focused on speed, mobile responsiveness, and a frictionless checkout process.

title: Algis
shortDescription: Agricultural Management System for Algeria's Ministry of Agriculture.
description: Algis is a comprehensive Agricultural Management System designed for the National Office of Agricultural Development (Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development). It digitizes and streamlines management of Agricultural Production Units (UAPs) across Algeria, centralizing scattered Excel data into a relational database with role-based access control, livestock tracking, equipment management, and production analytics. Uses PostgreSQL for hosted versions and SQLite for local development. A potential enterprise upgrade using Rust, MySQL, HTMX, and jQuery is being proposed to the client.
statusReason: A temporary free trial is available. Full access requires payment.
personalExperience: Working on Algis for a client in the agricultural sector has been a rewarding experience. The project involves complex data modeling with Prisma to handle UAPs, livestock, machinery, crops, and their relationships. I'm building a modern full-stack dashboard that replaces manual Excel-based workflows with a dynamic web application featuring authentication and role-based access. The repository is private due to client terms of service.

title: C-Studio
shortDescription: Zero-setup C IDE for Windows with bundled compiler.
description: C-Studio is a modern, lightweight IDE designed for beginners and students learning C. It eliminates the headache of installing compilers and configuring paths by bundling a portable MinGW toolchain directly into the application. Features include zero setup, bundled compiler, modern dark-themed UI, instant compile and run, and full interactive terminal support for scanf and input functions.
personalExperience: Building C-Studio was an exciting journey into desktop application development with Electron. The biggest challenge was bundling the MinGW compiler and ensuring it works seamlessly without any system configuration. I focused on creating a user-friendly experience for beginners learning C programming, with features like instant compilation and interactive terminal support.

title: ITC Hub
shortDescription: An internal platform to streamline communication, project management, and collaboration.
description: A comprehensive, internal platform built to manage departments, teams, a full ticketing system, and an event calendar. Features a role-based user management system (Admin, Manager, User), secure authentication, and a notification system to foster an organized and efficient workflow.
personalExperience: Developing ITC Hub was a deep dive into full-stack Next.js development. The biggest challenge was designing the relational database schema with Prisma to handle complex relationships between users, departments, teams, and tickets. Implementing role-based access control (RBAC) with Next-Auth was a critical feature to ensure data security. This project solidified my skills in building secure, scalable, and data-intensive web applications.

title: Remdani Dental Center
description: A professional website for Remdani Dental Center, showcasing services, team members, and patient testimonials. The platform provides a user-friendly interface for patients to learn about dental care and contact the clinic.
personalExperience: Collaborated as a Frontend Developer on this project, working closely with the backend developer and deployment lead. I also contributed to the backend development with small commits, gaining exposure to the full stack.

title: Sunrise Energy
description: A modern web platform designed for a renewable energy company. This project serves as a client preview to demonstrate the potential for a digital presence in the energy sector. It features a clean, eco-friendly design and showcases services and solutions.
statusReason: The project preview has been temporarily disabled due to unresolved contract negotiations with the client.
personalExperience: This project allowed me to focus on creating a professional and visually appealing interface for a corporate client. I utilized Next.js for performance and SEO, ensuring the site is fast and discoverable.

title: AiHorizons
description: A dynamic platform for an AI conference, featuring event schedules, speaker profiles, and registration. This project was a rapid development challenge, delivered in just 3 days.
personalExperience: This was a high-intensity project where I collaborated closely with a backend developer and a UI/UX designer to deliver a polished product in a very short timeframe. It tested my ability to work under pressure and coordinate effectively with a team.

title: ITC Talks
shortDescription: Event platform for ITC talks and presentations.
description: A dedicated platform for hosting and managing ITC talks. It provides a space for speakers to share their knowledge and for attendees to discover upcoming events.
personalExperience: Collaborated with a UI/UX designer to bring the vision of ITC Talks to life. Focused on creating an engaging user experience and a seamless content management flow.

title: ITCP
shortDescription: Official website for the ITC Programming Club.
description: The official website for the ITC Programming Club, designed to showcase club activities, events, and resources for members. A collaborative effort to build a community hub.
personalExperience: Worked as a Frontend Developer in a team with a backend developer and a UI/UX designer. This project enhanced my teamwork skills and my ability to integrate frontend components with backend APIs.

title: CSE Hub
description: A central hub for the CSE USDB promo 2023, providing information about the club, its departments, and events. This was my first project as a software engineer.
personalExperience: My first significant project as a Frontend Developer. I collaborated with a UI/UX designer to translate designs into code, laying the foundation for my career in software engineering.

title: Microservices & DevOps
shortDescription: Spring Boot microservices with H2 database.
description: A technical project demonstrating the implementation of microservices architecture using Spring Boot and H2 database. Focuses on backend logic, data persistence, and DevOps practices.
personalExperience: Expanded my skillset into backend and DevOps by working with Java Spring Boot and microservices. This project gave me a deeper understanding of full-stack architecture and database management.

title: iShowOff
shortDescription: A forked CLI tool to display my latest projects on my GitHub profile.
description: iShowOff is a fork of a CLI tool that I customized to display my latest working projects on my GitHub profile README (github.com/samibentaiba/samibentaiba). Through this project, I learned how to effectively use GitHub Actions for automated workflows and CI/CD pipelines.
personalExperience: This was a valuable learning experience with GitHub Actions. By forking and customizing this project, I gained hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated releases, and integrating dynamic content into my GitHub profile README.
